      public InputValidator()

  • Method Details

    • isValidUsername

      public boolean isValidUsername(String username)
      Checks whether the given username is valid according to certain criteria.
      Parameters:
      username - the string representing the username to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the username meets all the validation criteria outlined below, false otherwise.

      Criteria for a valid username: 1. Does not contain any spaces. 2. Does not start with a special character (-, _, or .). 3. Does not end with - or . 4. Does not contain any characters that are not letters or digits or one of the allowed special characters (-, _, or .).

    • isPossibleToDrawMore

      public boolean isPossibleToDrawMore(ArrayList<Square> hand, Square[][] board)
      Checks if the current board configuration allows the player to draw more tiles
      Parameters:
      hand - ArrayList of tiles taken by the player in this turn
      board - gameboard
      Returns:
      true if there are other tiles the player can pick (based on what he's already picked and the board configuration)

    • invalidCoordFormat

      public static boolean invalidCoordFormat(String input)
      This method splits the input string on commas and checks if there are exactly two parts. If not, it returns `true`. If there are two parts, it attempts to parse them as integers using `Integer.parseInt()`. If either of them cannot be parsed as an integer (due to a non-numeric character being present, for example), the method returns `true`. Otherwise, it returns `false`. Note that this implementation assumes the input string contains only ASCII digits, whitespace, and commas. If other characters are allowed, the parsing logic would need to be adapted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      input - the string which format is to be evaluated
      Returns:
      true if the String format is invalid

    • invalidColumnFormat

      public boolean invalidColumnFormat(String input)
      Checks if the input format is one exact number which fits in the bookshelf's dimension. If not, it returns 'true'.
      Parameters:
      input - chosen column
      Returns:
      valid column

    • invalidNumOfPlayersFormat

      public boolean invalidNumOfPlayersFormat(String input)
      Checks if the input provided is a valid number of players format.
      Parameters:
      input - the input string to validate as number of players
      Returns:
      true if the input is not a valid number of players format, false otherwise

    • inLineTile

      public boolean inLineTile(int row, int column, ArrayList<Square> hand)
      Checks if the passed coordinates are those of a Square which is in a straight line (horizontal or vertical) and adjacent to the ones in the player's hand
      Parameters:
      row - row number of the Square to check
      column - column number of the Square to check
      hand - List of Squares (tiles) already picked by the player during this turn
      Returns:
      true if the passed coordinates are those of a Square which is in a straight line (horizontal or vertical) and adjacent to the ones in the player's hand

    • isTileAlreadyOnHand

      public boolean isTileAlreadyOnHand(int row, int column, ArrayList<Square> hand)

      Parameters:
      row - row number of the Square to check
      column - column number of the Square to check
      hand - List of Squares (tiles) already picked by the player during this turn
      Returns:

    • columnHasLessSpace

      public boolean columnHasLessSpace(int column, ArrayList<Integer> columns)
      Checks if the column chosen by the player has enough space to insert the players hand. If not it returns 'true'.
      Parameters:
      column - column that the player chose
      columns - arraylist of available columns
      Returns:
      valid chosen column

      Parameters:
      input - the input string to check
      Returns:
      true if the input is "yes" or "y", false otherwise

    • invalidOrderFormat

      public static boolean invalidOrderFormat(String input, int n)
      Same as invalidCoordsFormat but is generic
      Parameters:
      input - cli input
      n - number of numbers separated by the coma that you have in the input string
      Returns:
      true if the input represents an invalid order format, false otherwise.
